column4: does anyone know why an init.d script wont execute on startup but will run if it is run first thing from that directory??  ubuntu 10.04
yeah I was looking at the upstart stuff too.
how do you add it.  just make a conf file??  i cant find how to add it to startup
what are you trying to accomplish? if you want to run a command on boot, add it to /etc/rc.local
no need to write an init script
you didn't say it was vnc.. that requires X.. what package did you install ?
what's the exact command you used?
but the package doesn't install such a command!
yeah totally.  it sets up the server. I can connect to it...carbonsrv@carbonsrv:~$ vncserver
